intro: Phanera outimouta, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Phanera outimouta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
